intro: Xeraea brachystylis, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed xeraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters, often in shades of red or purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
